name: 餐旅行銷專案管理研究
description: This course is a three-hour graduate survey course focused on the strategic analysis and planning necessary to effectively match marketing strategies with changing macro, micro, and organizational environments. The course is intended to provide an understanding of the conceptual realm of hospitality marketing strategy and knowledge of the factors for consideration in making strategic marketing decisions in the hospitality industry. Pedagogy is based on business simulation, case analysis and discussion.
goals: To improve and broaden the student's abilities to identify hospitality marketing problems and to develop reasoned resolutions of these problems.

To develop an expanded appreciation and understanding of the relationship among marketing decision variables – product, price, promotion and channels – and how the whole package is put together for effectiveness.
To broaden the student's understanding of the scope and role of marketing as a
To examine the ethical challenges and opportunities in business marketing
syllabus:
**Week 1 – Introduction to the Course (3/3) (+ Students to form groups)**

**Week 2 – Marketing Management in the Hospitality Industry + 7Ps and 7Cs Marketing + Customer Perceived Value (CPV) + Value Proposition (VP) (3/10)**

**Week 3 – The Marketing Environment (SWOT, TOWS, PEST, PESTLE) + Market Segmentation, Targeting and Positioning (STP) + SWOT Analysis & TOWS Matrix (Group 1) (3/17)**

**Week 4 – Products and Services + Poster Design (Group 2) + (3/24)**

**Week 5 – Price + eDM Design (Group 3) (3/31)**

**Week 6 – Place + Website Design (Group 4) (4/7)**

**Week 7 – Promotion 1 + Content Marketing (Group 5) (4/14)**

**Week 8 – Promotion 2 + Internet Marketing + Social Media Marketing (4/21)**

**Week 9 – Market Research – Questionnaire Design (Group 6) + Focus Group Interview (Group 7) (4/28)**

**Week 10 – Brand & Branding 1 + Logo Design (Group 8) (5/5)**

**Week 11 – Brand & Branding 2 + Corporate Identity System (CIS) (Group 9) + Group Project Proposal Presentations (5/12)**

**Week 12 – Midterm Examination (5/19) (1.5 hour)**

**Week 13 – Guest Speaker\* / Field Trip\* (5/26) (\* to be confirmed)**

**Week 14 – People (Internal Marketing) + Process + Physical Evidence (6/2)**

**Week 15 –** **Service Quality Management (SQM)** **+ Experiential Marketing (6/9)**

**Week 16 – Group Project Presentations (6/16) (All Groups)**

Collaborative learning – group market research projects
